author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here on Tuesday remanded till March 11 V. Sudhakar and S. Malik Batcha, two of the 12 accused against whom non-bailable arrest warrants (NBWs) had been issued by the court on January 27 for not cooperating in disposing of an appeal preferred by Central Bureau of Investigation in 2010 against the acquittal of 17 accused in the 2007 Dinakaran newspaper office attack case.

A Division Bench of Justices A. Selvam and G. Chockalingam passed the order after the CBI officials produced the duo in the court on execution of the arrest warrant. With their arrest, the Central agency has so far arrested three of the 12 accused with the first arrestee M. Saravanamuthu alias ‘Sirpi’ Saravanan having been produced before the court on February 15 and also remanded till March 11.
title: CBI arrests two more in Dinakaran case
